intro: Sisyrinchium adenocarpum, commonly known as the woolly blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and fuzzy, hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low-growing, spreading habit. Its leaves are narrow and linear, while its flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Sisyrinchium adenocarpum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in open grasslands and woodland edges.
